runs.comm: a full toss outside off stump, Bopara clamps down on it and squeezes it past point for four!
good pace - wide of the off stump and Bopara decides to leave alone
punched very hard to point but it's superbly stopped. Good, sprawling effort
top shot. Just a little too short and wide and Bopara timed it beautifully past point
down the leg side - wide
better ball, dropped to leg by Bopara
smashed out to cover - again, wonderful timing, but very impressive fielding by Netherlands
flicked to leg - four more. Wrong line from Schiferli and it's easily clipped off his pads
cut hard to point - another good stop
better, tighter line on the off stump and cutting back into Wright, forcing off the back foot
driven inside out to mid-off
flicked to leg off his pads - neat timing and placement
driven out to the off side
decent pace from Nannes - 90mph - but it's quite comfortably defended on the back foot
ooh that looked sharp - a full length on the leg stump at 92.9mph. Tidiily tucked to leg
quick ball on his legs - wrong line from Nannes so far in this over. Flicked off his hip
this bloke's got wheels! That was seriously sharp, bouncing and lifting over Bopara's attempted hook. He's a little peeved that it's been wided
beaten by an absolute cracker! This is terrific stuff from Nannes. It pitched on leg stump and left him at stiffening pace
a touch fuller by Nannes, full enough for Bopara to flick this with (dare I suggest it?) Tendulkar-like elegance through midwicket. Excellent fielding, however, prevents four
guided down past point
a full toss and he misses out, clipping it to leg for just a single
on-driven past mid-on
angles in a touch to Wright who drives inside out, though rather lacks the power
that's a good nut - nice and full and straight enough. Squeezed out to the off side
bang! Only fractionally too straight, but Bopara just whipped it through midwicket with great power for four
full ball, smacked straight back to the bowler
and he starts with a wide down the leg side
much better - nice and full. Wright smacks it to ten Doeschate's right who fields brilliantly
a monster of a wide down the leg side. RTD hasn't quite got it right here
Wright goes for a drive but top-edges this - where's it gone? Nannes gives chase at wide mid-on, but he couldn't quite get there
squared up a touch, defends back to the bowler
excellent, full delivery - too full to drive
defended out to cover
oh, what a shot - square driven with flair and timing for four. He is looking in supreme touch, Bopara

clubbed, or wellied, over mid-on. Mistimed really - Wright's really trying to force his shots at the moment with plenty of bottom hand. It's working, but he does need to begin to time it, not just welly the ball
much fuller, much better. Clipped to leg but he gets two
ping! A real slog from Wright over midwicket, and it falls like a shell in the outfield
bang! He stands tall and absolutely slaps it square of the wicket. Terrific blow, that
squeezed out square of the wicket
tossed up outside off, driven to cover
flicked to midwicket
shorter length, Bopara works it down to long-on. They think about a second after an overthrow, but decide against it
nudged off his hip
full toss, worked to wide mid-on for another single
clamps forward and pats it out to the off side
elegantly driven over Borren's head, but long-off fields. Wonderful timing, mind
lines up a powerful drive, but he's, well, lacking power
turned to leg for a single
slams one down the ground, stepping outside the leg stump
one-legged flick to leg. Huge amounts of wristiness
how was he not bowled! Wright's got away with one there, attempting a Morganesque paddle-flick which so nearly knocked out his leg stump. It beats Smits, the keeper, too
tossed up on leg stump, and excellent running brings them two to midwicket
opens the face and carves it out to deep cover point
good, tight line and it's carefully driven out to the off side
steps down the pitch and outside leg stump, desperately trying to give himself more room to swing his arms. Just a single though
Bopara, too, gives himself room and gets two to the sweeper on the extra cover boundary
shot! Fantastic extra-cover drive and he fully committed to it. Bosh
driven to long-on
he's given that everything, smacking it down to long-on, but Netherlands' field-placings are excellent tonight
ooh, very nearly the first six! Wright steps outside leg and carves it over point for four
bludgeoned down the ground for two
a full toss, boshed over midwicket but there's a man on the boundary and, by heck, he does a splendid job of stopping it going for four
a huge swing and a miss!
Wright tries to whack this over long-on but it skies over point, and fortunately for him, safely so
banged down the ground
square-driven - good, tight line and encouraging pace
woops! A howling misfield at extra cover to a scorching drive. The bowler is furious
driven again to Mr Van Bunge, who again misfields to the delight of a now-drunk crowd
two more, to midwicket this time

four more! A full toss which pitched at about thigh height, and Wright wellied it over the top for four. Difficult to time shots like those with the ball dipping late on you, but he played it excellently
elegantly driven to long-on, who is a little slow off the blocks and they job a second with ease
excellent catch at long-on. Bopara went for a big slog across the line but skied it, forcing Seelaar long-on to run several yards back and to his right
full toss which Shah bashes out to long-off
good line and length. Shah drops it out to the off side for a zero
works this nicely off his pads
clipped off his pads to steal the strike
excellent ball! Very full, almost yorker length
full toss, defended to cover...
quicker ball on his toes, flicked to wide long-on
tickled around the corner
a touch slower and it's patted out to the off side
whips this to leg - excellent over that
down the pitch and somehow it lands safe at mid-on! They only get a single, too - shoddy cricket allround there.
clatters it along the turf to long-on
oops. Beautifully timed flick off his pads but straight down square-leg's throat, who barely needed to move a muscle
squeezes it out to the off side and immediately he's off the mark
angled to short third man. Morgan's backing up is quick and urgent and the single is easily stolen
opens the face, guiding to third man
nudged to leg for a single
steps to leg and cuts down to third man
ouch - that's quick. Nannes is seriously slippery. Morgan beaten for pace and is whacked on the stomach
goes for a pull, slapping it down to long-on
that's a great blow! Steps outside leg and hammers it over cover. A real piece of humpty, that - timed the pants off it
nudged to leg
carved out to the off side
steps forward onto the front foot, patting it out to the off side. Just like Stephen Fleming might have done, if that helps you picture it
fuller and quicker, nudged back to the bowler
reverse-swept straight to point! Usually such a productive shot for Morgan, and he timed this especially impressively, but just picked out the fielder
such of shape back into Collingwood who bashes it back to him
driven to long-off
down the pitch and he lofts it over the covers - and a horrible howler on the boundary gives him four!
pulled through midwicket
nice and full, down the leg side, Wright works it to long-on
full toss pulled, with a short-arm jab, for a rinky dinky little single
over the top for four! Wright rarely looks elegant when hitting over the top, but he is mighty effective
dropped him, though that was absolutely nailed back to the bowler at tremendous pace. Sheesh - he hit that with some power!
top scooping from Wright. Down on one knee and he flicks it, past his face, over the keeper's left shoulder for four! I love those shots. Outrageous quantities of cheek
got him this time! He tried to pull it over midwicket for six but it just didn't have quite the legs on it
dances down the crease and pats to cover
stroked to long-off for a single - err, for two I think. Key really has to get his skates on though, and Smits roars an appeal but it's little more than hopeful.
steps outside leg, chinks it out to mid-off
on one knee, flipped through midwicket
down the leg side and urgently clipped with chippy enthusiasm through midwicket
goes inside out, driving to mid-off
a slap to long-off
Key gives himself vast amounts of room, stepping outside leg, and lifts it over cover
full toss, Collingwood tries to loft him over the boundary but finds long-on
flicked around the corner
steps to leg to give himself room but slaps it straight to mid-off
full and straight, Key can only chip it to mid-off
Foster gets into a tangle, beaten for pace here and Foster's nearly run out as he delayed his run
a rare wide from Netherlands, down the leg side
slapped down to third man for just a single, again. Excellent, fast and tight bowling from Nannes
slapped to cover
a full toss, bunged to short midwicket
